result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan L. McFann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Avoid Penalty [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours community service per week.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances, unless prescribed and to only be taken as prescribed. 

No contact with any of the victims in any files unless approved by agent.

Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  AODA and follow up.  

DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dylan L. McFann

records.addlTxt:
11:05 a.m. 
Clerk Micki.
INCLUDES 22CF233, 22CF236, 22CF780, 22CM30, 22CF187, and 22CF602

State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck; Defendant appears in person in custody from the MCJ with Attorney Paige Metzman.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to:
22CF236
COUNT 3: Criminal Damage to Property, Repeater >> DRI.
COUNT 4: Graffiti, Repeater >> DRI.

22CF780
COUNT 2: Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, Repeater >> DRI.
COUNT 3: Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor, Repeater >> DRI. 

22CM30
COUNT 1: Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), Repeater >> DRI.
COUNT 2: Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, Repeater >> DRI.
COUNT 3: Disorderly Conduct, Repeater >> DRI.

22CM602
COUNT 1: Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, Repeater >> DRI.
COUNT 2: Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor, Repeater >> DRI.
COUNT 3: Possess Drug Paraphernalia, Repeater >> DRI.

COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to:
22CF233
COUNT 1: Misappropriate ID Info - Avoid Penalty, Repeater >> NO CONTEST. 

22CF236
COUNT 1: Burglary - Building or Dwelling, Repeater >> NO CONTEST.
COUNT 2: Criminal Damage to Property, Repeater >> NO CONTEST.

22CF780
COUNT 1: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, Repeater >> NO CONTEST.

22CM187
COUNT 1: Criminal Damage to Property, Repeater >> NO CONTEST. 

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS:  3 years in Wisconsin Prison System (1 year IC; 2 years ES); CONDITIONS OF ES: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week; Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances, unless prescribed and to only be taken as prescribed; AODA and f/u; N/C with any of the victims in any files unless approved by agent; Restitution in the amount of $250.00, plus 10% surcharge in 22CF780 to N.A.G., $799.60, plus 10% surcharge in 22CF236 to D.J.S., and amount is contested in 22CM187; CC; and DNA sample and surcharge. 49 days jail credit. 

Adj: 11:28 a.m.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Restitution hearing on August 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea hearing on August 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Clerk Micki.

Date and time set for a Plea Hearing.

ADA Boeck makes statement regarding not being in compliance with victim's rights. Asking for the Plea to be rescheduled. Will also need a restitution hearing.
Atty Metzman is in agreement.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Includes cases 22CM187, 22CM30, 22CF236, 22CF233, 22CM602, 22CF780. No contact with victim(s):  E.G.N., D.J.S., N.J.B., S.M.S., N.A.G. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Absolute sobriety from, and no possession of controlled substances, except prescriptions taken as prescribed. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Amanda.
Cases called at 2:16 pm.
INCLUDES: 22CF233, 22CF236, 22CF780 , 22CM30, 22CM187, and 22CM602. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears from MCJ, and with Attorney Adam Fontana.
Date and Time set for IA in all files and return on warrant in 22CM30; VRCW. 

COURT QUASHES WARRANTS. 

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

Prelim Time Limits Preserved. 

PLEA:  NOT GUILTY. 
PO HOLD. 

COURT ORDERS: $2500 cash bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s):  E.G.N., D.J.S., N.J.B., S.M.S., N.A.G. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
- Absolute sobriety from, and no possession of controlled substances, except prescriptions taken as prescribed. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

>>FUTURE DATES: 
RH: 6/29 at 1 in B.
PH: 7/5 at 10:00 in B.
PTC: 7/6 at 9:10.
